data.text:
Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc is easily one of the best anime of this year and rightly so. The anime has won the hearts of fans all across the world with its amazing animation and storyline. The fourth installment of the anime has already released two episodes and a third one is almost here. Read on to find out the complete streaming guide of the Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3:

Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3 exact release date and time:

Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3 will be released on Saturday, May 26 at 11:15 PM JST.

Here's the release time of Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3 for the global audience:

Japan Standard Time (JST): May 26, 2024, 11:15 PM JST

Pacific Time (PT): May 26, 2024, 10:45 AM

Eastern Time (ET): May 26, 2024, 1:45 PM ET

British Summer Time (BST): May 26, 2024, 6:45 PM BST

Greenwich Mean Time (GMT): May 26, 2024, 5:45 PM GMT

Indian Standard Time (IST): May 26, 2024, 11:15 PM IST

Where to watch Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3:

Fans in Japan can watch the series on local networks. However, those in other countries can stream Episode 3 on Crunchyroll and Netflix.

What Happened in Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc Episode 3 ?

The main emphasis of Demon Slayer: Hashira Training Arc's second episode was Water Hashira Giyu Tomioka and his challenging past. The head of the Demon Slayer Corps, Kagaya Ubuyashiki, urged Tanjiro to try to persuade Giyu to participate in the Hashira Training.

Initially, Giyu was unresponsive to Tanjiro's attempts but he eventually spoke up about some unsettling parts of his past, which helps to explain why he was reluctant to participate in the Hashira Training, after much prodding from Tanjiro.

Also read: Demon Slayer Season 5 Might Just Be Around The Corner: Hereâ€™s Why

Tanjiro urged Giyu to carry on as a Hashira and pass on the knowledge and talents that Sabito had bestowed upon him. Giyu consented to participate in the Hashira Training following this interaction.

Tanjiro's wounds from the Swordsmith Village arc will be entirely healed in the upcoming episode. He will be able to take part in the much anticipated Hashira Training activities now that he is back to his healthy self.
